verses.kjv: Blessed is he that considereth the poor: the LORD will deliver him in time of trouble.
verses.ct: How fortunate is the person who cares for the weak — the LORD will rescue him when trouble comes.

verses.kjv: The LORD will preserve him, and keep him alive; and he shall be blessed upon the earth: and thou wilt not deliver him unto the will of his enemies.
verses.ct: The LORD will protect him and keep him alive; he will be considered fortunate throughout the land, and you will not hand him over to his enemies.

verses.kjv: The LORD will strengthen him upon the bed of languishing: thou wilt make all his bed in his sickness.
verses.ct: The LORD will support him when he is lying sick in bed; you will restore him completely from his illness.

verses.kjv: I said, LORD, be merciful unto me: heal my soul; for I have sinned against thee.
verses.ct: I prayed, 'LORD, show me mercy. Heal my soul, because I have sinned against you.'

verses.kjv: Mine enemies speak evil of me, When shall he die, and his name perish?
verses.ct: My enemies say hateful things about me: 'When will he finally die and be forgotten?'

verses.kjv: And if he come to see me, he speaketh vanity: his heart gathereth iniquity to itself; when he goeth abroad, he telleth it.
verses.ct: When one of them visits me, he speaks empty words while his mind collects ammunition against me; then he goes outside and spreads it around.

verses.kjv: All that hate me whisper together against me: against me do they devise my hurt.
verses.ct: Everyone who hates me huddles together whispering about me, plotting ways to harm me.

verses.kjv: An evil disease, say they, cleaveth fast unto him: and now that he lieth he shall rise up no more.
verses.ct: They say, 'A deadly disease has taken hold of him — now that he's down, he'll never get back up.'

verses.kjv: Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted, which did eat of my bread, hath lifted up his heel against me.
verses.ct: Even my closest friend, someone I completely trusted, who shared meals at my table, has turned against me.

verses.kjv: But thou, O LORD, be merciful unto me, and raise me up, that I may requite them.
verses.ct: But you, LORD, show me mercy and raise me up so that I can repay them for what they've done.

verses.kjv: By this I know that thou favourest me, because mine enemy doth not triumph over me.
verses.ct: This is how I know you look on me with favor — my enemy does not get to celebrate victory over me.

verses.kjv: And as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest me before thy face for ever.
verses.ct: As for me, you hold me up because of my integrity, and you keep me in your presence forever.

verses.kjv: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting, and to everlasting. Amen, and Amen.
verses.ct: Praise the LORD, the God of Israel, from eternity past to eternity future. Amen and amen.
